profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nsyoc.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: James MacKillop Collection
did.abstract: The James MacKillop collection contains material donated to the Onondaga Community College archives by English Professor James MacKillop. Material includes Master's thesis and doctoral dissertation, manuscripts for books written or edited by James MacKillop and correspondence with fellow writers.

controlaccess.subject: Mythology, celtic
Film criticism
Irish literature 20th century History and criticism

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers without restriction.

bioghist.p: Dr. James MacKillop was a professor of English at Onondaga Community College from 1967 to 1999. As a professional writer for over thirty years, MacKillop published books and articles about Celtic mythology and Irish Literature. His most well-known titles are the "Dictionary of Celtic Mythology" (1998), and "Myths & Legends of the Celts" (2005). MacKillop received a PhD in English Literature from Syracuse University. He is currently the editor of the Irish Series at Syracuse University Press.

scopecontent.p: The collection comprises archival materials relating to the professional career of James MacKillop. The materials are arranged as given by the author. The main categories of the collection manuscripts and correspondence relating to "Envisioning Ireland" anthology, "Dictionary of Celtic Mythology" manuscripts, "Irish Literature: A Reader" manuscripts, series: "The Myth of Finn MacCool in the English Literature: A Study of a Celtic Archetype in the Works of James MacPherson, Flann O'Brien, James Joyce and Others" by James MacKillop (Ph.D dissertation), "Penguin Guide to Celtic Mythology" manuscripts, and MacKillop's Master's Thesis on T.E. Hulme.

Series 1: "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema" papers. This series includes material related to the book, "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema" edited by James MacKillop. Materials include manuscripts and correspondence with contributing writers to the book. Correspondence, arranged by MacKillop, is alphabetical by author's last name.
Series 2: "Dictionary of Celtic Mythology" papers. This series includes material related to the book, "Dictionary of Celtic Mythology." Material includes manuscripts and newspaper clipping.

Series 3: "Irish Literature: A Reader" papers. This series contains material related to, "Irish Literature: A reader" written by James MacKillop and Maureen O'Rourke. Contains manuscript and galley proof.

Series 4: "The Myth of Finn MacCool in the English Literature: A Study of a Celtic Archetype in the Works of James MacPherson, Flann O'Brien, James Joyce and Others." This series contain's a copy of MacKillop's PhD dissertation.

Series 5: "Penguin Guide to Celtic Mythology" papers. This series contains material related to the book, "Penguin Guide to Celtic Mythology" by James MacKillop. Materials included manuscripts and page proofs.
Series 6: Master's Thesis on T.E. Hume. This series contains a copy of James MacKillop's Master's thesis.

userestrict.p: Written permission from the Onondaga Community College Archives and all copyright holders must be obtained before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any material in this collection.

did.unittitle: "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema" by James MacKillop (Editor)
did.abstract: Typed manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema," edited by James MacKillop. 418 pages. Correspondence with authors of essays for the book included.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" Publication
did.abstract: Typed sheets to authors of content for "Envisioning Ireland" regarding publication sent by James MacKillop. Includes release for publication sheets.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Margot Gayle Backus
did.abstract: Typed copies, with revisions, of "Revising Resistance: In the Name of the Father as Postcolonial Paternal Melodrama" by Margot Gayle Backus. Includes floppy disk, bibliography and note to James MacKillop.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Susan M. Bernardo
did.abstract: Typed letters from Susan M. Bernardo to James MacKillop regarding "Veiling the Gaze in the The Crying Game: Through a Glass Darkly," an essay to appear in "Envisioning Ireland." Includes manuscript of "Veiling the Gaze" and 2 floppy disks.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Douglas Brode
did.abstract: Correspondence regarding "Man's Mythic Journey and the Female Principle in My Left Foot," essay by Douglas Brode for "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes typed manuscript of essay, floppy disk, and typed letter by James MacKillop to Brode with editorial comments.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Marina Burke
did.abstract: Typed letters from Marina Burke to James Burke regarding "Neil Jordan's the Crying Game in the Context of Issues of Race and Transexuality in the Film." Includes typed manuscript of the essay for "Envisioning Ireland."

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Jennifer Cornell
did.abstract: Typed letters regarding essay, "'Different Countries, Different Worlds': The Representation of Northern Ireland in Stewart Parker's 'Lost Belongings,'" for "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes essay manuscript and floppy disk.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" Ian Crump
did.abstract: Typed letter from Ian Crump regarding essay under consideration for "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes typed manuscripts for essay, "Male Bonding: O'Connor, Behan, and Jordan."

did.unittitle: Photocopy of "Seamus and Sinead: From 'Limbo' to Saturday Night Live by way of Hush-a-Bye Baby" by Elizabeth Cullingford
did.abstract: Photocopy of essay titled, "Photocopy of "Seamus and Sinead: From 'Limbo' to Saturday Night Live by way of Hush-a-Bye Baby" by Elizabeth Cullingford

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Marianne Eismann
did.abstract: Letters to James MacKillop regarding essay, "Secret Sharers: Forming Community in Neil Jordan's 'The Crying Game.'" Includes manuscripts for essay and floppy disks.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Helen Emmitt
did.abstract: Letters regarding essay, "'It's Only a Piece of Meat': Gender and Signification in 'The Crying Game'" for inclusion in "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes manuscripts and floppy disk.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with University of Florida Press
did.abstract: Letters to James MacKillop from University of Florida Press regarding "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes formatting guidelines for authors for publication.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland"
did.abstract: Various correspondence relating to "Envisioning Ireland" book. Includes postcard from contributing writer, Jennifer Cornell, letters from University Press of Florida, and typed letters to book contributors from James MacKillop.

did.unittitle: Postcard and Manuscript from Leonard Frey to James MacKillop
did.abstract: Postcard and Manuscript from Leonard Frey to James MacKillop

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with John Hill
did.abstract: Typed letter to James MacKillop with typed manuscript for essay, "'The Past is Always There in the Present:' Fools of Fortune and the Heritage Film."

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Kerstin Ketteman
did.abstract: Letters regarding manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland" book. Manuscript titled "Cinematic Images of Irish Male Brutality and the Semiotics of Landscape in 'The Field' and 'Hear My Song.'" Floppy disk included.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Anthony Kirby
did.abstract: Typed and hand-written letters between Anthony Kirby and James MacKillop regarding "A Filmography if Irish and Irish-Related Feature Films" by Kirby.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts of Anthony Kirby's Essay for "Envisioning Ireland"
did.abstract: Copies of Anthony Kirby's "Selected Filmography of Irish & Irish-Related Feature Films."

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Jim Loter
did.abstract: Letter from Jim Loter regarding paper for "Envisioning Ireland." Includes first page of paper, footnotes, and floppy disk.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Kathleen McCracken
did.abstract: Typed and hand-written letters from Kathleen McCracken regarding essay for "Envisioning Ireland" book. Various versions of the manuscript for the essay included.

did.unittitle: Manuscript for"Envisioning Ireland" by Martin McLoone
did.abstract: Typed manuscript titled, "'December Bride:' A Landscape Peopled Differently" by Martin McLoone for "Envisioning Ireland" book.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Brian McIlroy
did.abstract: Typed letters and manuscripts from Brian McIlroy to James MacKillop. Several versions of "The Feminist Historical and Political Documentary Reconsidered: Anne Crilly's 'Mother Ireland.'"

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Moylan C. Mills
did.abstract: Typed letters and manuscripts regarding essay for "Envisioning Ireland." Essay titled "Huston and Joyce: Bringing 'The Dead' to the Screen. Floppy disk included.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Maria Pramaggiore
did.abstract: Letters regarding essay for "Envisioning Ireland." Several versions of essay, titled, "'I Kinda Liked You as a Girl': The 'Nature' of Terrorism, Sexual Politics and Postcolonial Queens in Neil Jordan's 'The Crying Game,'" included. Floppy disk included.

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Lori Rogers
did.abstract: Letters and correspondence regarding essay titled, "'That's Everybody's Tune': Images of Celticism in Neil Jordan's 'Angel." Several versions of essay manuscript included.

did.unittitle: Sanford Sternlcht's Manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland" Book
did.abstract: Three copies of manuscript of essay titled, "Synge on Film: Two Playboys."

did.unittitle: Gail Sweeney Manuscript for Envisioning Ireland
did.abstract: Manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland" titled "'A Good Stick to Beat the Lovely Lady': Violence and Equality in John Ford's 'The Quiet Man.'"

did.unittitle: Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland" with Kathy Gallagher Winarski
did.abstract: Letters to James MacKillop regarding "Envisioning Ireland" essay. Includes copies of manuscript for the book. Includes floppy disk. Essay is titled "Neil Jordan's Miracle: From Fiction to Film."

did.unittitle: Manuscript for "The Quiet Man Speaks" by James MacKillop for "Envisioning Ireland" book.
did.abstract: Typed manuscript and photo-copied manuscript for "The Quiet Man Speaks" by James MacKillop.

did.unittitle: Footnotes Manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland"
did.abstract: Typed footnotes for "Envisioning Ireland" book.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Correspondence Regarding "Envisioning Ireland"
did.abstract: Miscellaneous letters to James MacKillop regarding "Envisioning Ireland Book."

did.unittitle: "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema" Manuscript by James MacKillop (Editor)
did.abstract: Typed manuscript for "Envisioning Ireland: Essays on Irish Cinema," edited by James MacKillop. 418 pages.
